GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON

GOVERNOR DIRECTOR

Morning Star Adoption Center

15635 W. Twelve Mile Rd.
Southfield, MI 48076
RE: License #: CB630246843
Morning Star Adoption Center
Ste 100
15635 W. Twelve Mile Rd.
Southfield, MI 48076
Dear Ms. Wisneski:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
05/17/2021. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Implementation and
Sustainability Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any
licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Vivian D. Malleck, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3284
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is
in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements. Morning Star Adoption Center is not a DHHS contracted program.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas: None at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
To contact the consultant in special circumstances with securing clearances for
prospective adoptive parents due to COVID 19 impacting processing times.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Morning Star Adoption Center submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not
related to maltreatment during this licensing period. The corrective action plan is
from their 05/2020 renewal inspection. R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation was
cited. Compliance was found in the adoption evaluation reviewed for this inspection.
Each family member of the household was interviewed for the evaluation. The
interviews were completed in a virtual format due to COVID 19.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
05/19/2021
